definition: suitable for both the young and the old

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom

sentences.english: ‘The Jungle Book’ is a fantastic book to read and is suitable for all ages.
sentences.chinese: 我們知道《叢林故事》是老少皆宜值得一讀的書。

sentences.english: It is a game for young and old .
sentences.chinese: 這是一種老少皆宜的運動。

sentences.english: The contemporary riddle culture includes sophisticated puzzles for both children and adults.
sentences.chinese: 現代的謎語文化中也有老少皆宜的精妙謎題。

sentences.english: What sport can learn and easy to understand, ages beneficial to everyone?
sentences.chinese: 什麼體育項目能易學易懂，老少皆宜對大家都有益？

sentences.english: Taijiquan is an especially helpful exercise to both old and young.
sentences.chinese: 太極拳是一種老少皆宜的運動。

sentences.english: This is a book for young and old.
The tree house is definitely a fun fair for both young and old.

sentences.english: The nourishing Beverages for all ages produced By our factory are most welcome to customers.

sentences.english: Safe for all family members to use, smells good and works at preventing bites.
sentences.chinese: 對全家老少皆宜，好聞並且有效防止蚊叮蟲咬。

sentences.english: Tea is suitable beverage for all ages.

sentences.english: Lianliankan is one of the game young and old ages.

sentences.english: Walking is a good exercise for both young and old.
sentences.chinese: 散步是一種老少皆宜的運動。

sentences.english: It is good for health as a heathy tea.
sentences.chinese: 桑茶是一種有保健作用的老少皆宜的健身茶。

sentences.english: Summer can be cold in winter while hot cooking, ages.
sentences.chinese: 夏可涼拌，冬則熱烹，老少皆宜。

sentences.english: Oh, we should also mention that it also has an ergonomic design and is perfect for all ages.

definition: to grow the intellect/Alpinia oxyphylla, a type of ginger (Chinese medicine)
men, women, young and old/all kinds of people/people of all ages
to whet the appetite/appetizing/to amuse oneself at sb's expense/to tease
to nourish one's skin/to maintain a youthful appearance
leaving a rich aftertaste/(fig.) memorable/lingering in memory
to smell, look and taste great
